info.description:
The iQualify API offers management and analytics responses for building
learning experiences using your iQualify instance data.

Once youâ€™ve registered with iQualify, you can request an API access token by
navigating to the API access section of the "Account Settings" area.

Find out how to [Request your API access token](https://intercom.help/iqualify/iqualify-set-up/authentication/requesting-your-api-access-token) on our Knowledge base.

All endpoints are only accessible via https and are located at
api.iqualify.com. For instance: you can find your current offerings by
accessing the following URL:

    https://api.iqualify.com/v1/offerings/current
info.title: iQualify

get.description: Responds with all supported endpoints URLs for v1 version.
Returns all the course mappings

get.summary: Finds course mappings by offering id

delete.description: Removes the course mapping between the offering and the external course id

put.description: Creates a mapping between the offering and the external course id

get.description: Responds with courses that can be activated (made to an offering).

200.description: All courses that can be activated

201.description: user successfully added to the course with the specified permission.

schema.title: users to be added to the offering.

get.description: Responds with all offerings for your organisation.

200.description: all offerings (current, past and future ones)

get.summary: Get current, past and future offerings

version.description: Content version, if not specified, the most recent version is used.

get.description: Responds with current (active) offerings for your organisation. Offering is current when today's date is between (inclusive) it's `start` and `end` date.
Responds with future (inactive) offerings for your organisation. Future offerings have their `start` date after today's date (inclusive).
Responds with past (inactive) offerings for your organisation. Past offerings have their `end` date before today's date (inclusive).
Returns an offering matching the offeringId.

version.description: Content version, if not specified, the most recent version is used.

get.description: Responds with a list of all comments in any of the posts for a channel in a offering
Responds with a list of posts for a channel in a offering
Responds with a list of all replies in any of the posts for a channel in a offering
Responds with learners progress.
Responds with assignments marks.
Responds with quizzes marks.
Returns ids of all pulses that learners responded to.
Returns pulses' responses matching the offeringId.

parameters.description: Filter pulse responses by responseTime. Lower then (`lt`), lower then or equal (`lte`), greater then (`gt`) and greater then or equal (`gte`) operators are available. Example of filtering by time range __responseTime=gte\_\_2017-03-14T07:30:00Z&responseTime=lte\_\_2017-03-16T09:30:00Z__
parameters.name: responseTime
